name: Patient Identification
description: The PID segment is used by all applications as the primary means of communicating patient identification information. This segment contains permanent patient identifying and demographic information that, once established, is not likely to change frequently.

cardinality.note: PID segment is required and appears exactly once per patient in most message types

PID.1.name: Set ID - PID
PID.1.description: This field contains the number that identifies this transaction. For the first occurrence of the segment, the sequence number shall be one; for the second occurrence, the sequence number shall be two; etc.
PID.1.generationHint: Usually 1 for single patient messages, increment for multiple patients

PID.2.name: Patient ID
PID.2.description: This field is retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.3.1. The reader is referred to PID.3 - patient identifier list.

PID.3.name: Patient Identifier List
PID.3.description: This field contains the list of identifiers (one or more) used by the healthcare facility to uniquely identify a patient (e.g., medical record number, billing number, birth registry, national identifier, etc.).
PID.3.generationHint: Generate at least MRN, optionally add SSN or other identifiers

PID.3.1.name: ID Number
PID.3.1.description: This string refers to the actual identifier.
PID.3.1.generationHint: Generate realistic MRN or other ID format

PID.3.2.name: Check Digit
PID.3.2.description: The check digit is used to verify the validity of the identifier.
PID.3.2.generationHint: Usually omitted unless specific algorithm required

PID.3.3.name: Code Identifying the Check Digit Scheme Employed
PID.3.3.description: This component contains the code for the check digit scheme employed.

validValues.description: Check digit algorithm in the US National Provider Identifier

PID.3.3.generationHint: Usually omitted unless check digit is provided

PID.3.4.name: Assigning Authority
PID.3.4.description: The assigning authority is a unique name of the system/organization/agency/department that creates the data.
PID.3.4.generationHint: Use facility or system name that assigns the identifier

PID.3.5.name: Identifier Type Code
PID.3.5.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the Assigning authority component.
PID.3.5.generationHint: Most common: MR for medical record number, SS for social security

PID.5.name: Patient Name
PID.5.description: This field contains the names for the patient. Multiple names for the same patient may be sent in subsequent name fields (e.g., maiden name, nickname, etc.).
PID.5.generationHint: Generate realistic names, typically one legal name

PID.5.1.name: Family Name
PID.5.1.description: This component allows for family names, including the family name surname and family name prefix.

PID.5.3.name: Second and Further Given Names or Initials Thereof

PID.5.4.name: Suffix
PID.5.4.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).
PID.5.4.generationHint: Usually omitted, occasionally Jr or III

PID.5.5.name: Prefix
PID.5.5.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).
PID.5.5.generationHint: Usually omitted for patients, may include for providers

PID.7.name: Date/Time of Birth
PID.7.description: This field contains the patient's date and time of birth.
PID.7.generationHint: Generate realistic birth date, typically YYYYMMDD format

PID.8.name: Administrative Sex
PID.8.description: This field contains the patient's sex.
PID.8.generationHint: Generate M or F most commonly, occasionally U for unknown

PID.11.name: Patient Address
PID.11.description: This field contains the mailing address of the patient.
PID.11.generationHint: Generate realistic US address with street, city, state, zip

PID.13.name: Phone Number - Home
PID.13.description: This field contains the patient's personal telephone number.
PID.13.generationHint: Generate realistic US phone number format

PID.18.name: Patient Account Number
PID.18.description: This field contains the external identifier used by the healthcare facility for billing purposes.
PID.18.generationHint: Generate account number if billing context needed

PID.19.name: SSN Number - Patient
PID.19.description: This field contains the patient's social security number.
PID.19.generationHint: Generate fake SSN using 9XX format to avoid real numbers

notes: PID segment must appear in most message types involving patient data
PID.3 (Patient Identifier List) is the most critical field - at minimum should contain MRN
Generation hints guide the algorithmic generator for realistic data creation
